  "description": "Krishat Pharma Industries Limited is a pharmaceutical drug manufacturing company in Ibadan, Oyo state and headquartered at Lagos state. From past 9 years, company has been developing and manufacturing pharmaceutical products in Nigeria and selling and distributing these in over 50 different locations in west-African region.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Marketer

Job Location:&nbsp;Enugu

Qualifications


	OND, HND, or B.Sc. in Social Sciences or related courses.
	Experience in the sales of pharmaceutical products will be an added advantage.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;hr.krishatpharma025@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

Marketer Job at Krishat Pharma Industries Limited




        
    

        
        Krishat Pharma Industries Limited is a pharmaceutical drug manufacturing company in Ibadan, Oyo state and headquartered at Lagos state. From past 9 years, company has been developing and manufacturing pharmaceutical products in Nigeria and selling and distributing these in over 50 different locations in west-African region.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Marketer

Job Location: Enugu

Qualifications
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	OND, HND, or B.Sc. in Social Sciences or related courses.
	Experience in the sales of pharmaceutical products will be an added advantage.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr.krishatpharma025@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Medical Doctor",
  "description": "EHA Clinics, a subsidiary of eHealth Africa, is a health care network operating across Nigeria that provides high-quality, innovative, data-driven, and technology-enabled services. EHA Clinics delivers a comprehensive range of state of the art health care services in each location, e.g,&nbsp; general consultations, laboratory investigations, pharmaceuticals, annual medical checks, child wellness checks, ultrasonography, and specialized services (urgent care, telemedicine, home care, dental care, and ophthalmology).

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Medical Doctor

Job Location:&nbsp;Sangotedo,&nbsp;Lagos
Job Type: Full Time

Job Description


	The clinical services department ensures delivery of high quality medical and laboratory services that are patient centered in order to ensure optimal health and well being for patients achieving the organization&rsquo;s mission and vision.
	The Medical Doctor will perform a range of functions including but not limited to; initial history taking, clinical assessments, diagnosis, treatment, and evaluation of care.
	S/he must demonstrate critical thinking in the clinical decision-making process, especially in assessing and diagnosing patients, leading to the delivery of safe care for all patients.
	The successful candidate will work collaboratively with the healthcare team and the Management Team to meet the needs of the patients, supporting the delivery of policy and procedures.
	The Medical Doctor will also review and act appropriately on blood results and referrals/correspondence regarding patients.
	In addition, S/he will be expected to occasionally carry out some home visits to patients registered on the Membership Scheme.


Responsibilities
Purpose:


	Conduct telemedicine consultations which may involve discussing results and implications of laboratory investigations with patients as well as dealing appropriately with routine and emergency complaints.
	Determine diagnosis and treatment plans, in consultation with patient(s) or referring to Supervising doctor(s) as appropriate. Conduct and oversee clinical care to patients using established clinical guidelines.
	Interview patients, take medical histories, perform physical examinations, analyze,determine, diagnose and explain medical problems during surgery consultations and home visits.
	Participate and oversee all treatment and preventative healthcare services as delegated and agreed upon by the supervising Practice Manager(s). Assist in clinical instruction and supervision of medical and nursing staff as well as other interns/student doctors.&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;


Engagement:


	Provide and explain clinical instructions to the nursing staff and other clinical care teams as required. Communicate when necessary with colleagues in Clinical care and hospital specialists in order to discuss or refer specific patients, plan and coordinate activities, or exchange information.
	Communicate where necessary with colleagues in Clinical care and hospital specialists to discuss or recommend referring specific patients, plan and coordinate activities, or exchange information to improve the quality of patient care.&nbsp;
	Identify and liaise regularly with community hospitals, consultants, and other health care providers, insurance companies, and other community organizations to refer/consult on specific cases, participate in community service and education projects and activities.
	Recommend direct clinical care to patients using established clinical guidelines. Interview patients, take medical histories, perform physical examinations, analyze, diagnose, and explain medical problems during surgery consultations and home visits.


Delivery:


	Fully document all aspects of patient care, reconcile and complete all required paperwork for legal and administrative purposes. Attend regular educational meetings organized by the practice in order to clinical knowledge, practice policy and guidelines timely
	Contribute to clinical development by developing a special interest and help to establish appropriate systems to manage common chronic medical conditions, ensuring compliance with approved standard treatment guidelines.
	Support and Sustain clinical research and efforts within the EHA Clinics leading to the publication of papers.


Requirements&nbsp;?


	Degree In Medicine - MBBS, MbChB, MD, DO in any Global, National, or State recognized University and conforming to the guidelines as set out by the Medical and Dental Association of Nigeria.
	Completion of compulsory internship and a minimum of post NYSC.&nbsp;
	Up-to-date registration and license from the MDCN
	Completion of BLS, ACLS.
",
  "datePosted": "2025-12-09",
  "validThrough": "2026-01-10",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "EHA Clinics"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Lagos",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },
  "identifier": {
    "@type": "PropertyValue",
    "name": "",
    "value": "191553"
  },
  "baseSalary": {
    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",
    "value": {
      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 0,
      "maxValue": 0,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



Medical Doctor Job at EHA Clinics




        
    

        
        EHA Clinics, a subsidiary of eHealth Africa, is a health care network operating across Nigeria that provides high-quality, innovative, data-driven, and technology-enabled services. EHA Clinics delivers a comprehensive range of state of the art health care services in each location, e.g,  general consultations, laboratory investigations, pharmaceuticals, annual medical checks, child wellness checks, ultrasonography, and specialized services (urgent care, telemedicine, home care, dental care, and ophthalmology).

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Medical Doctor

Job Location: Sangotedo, Lagos
Job Type: Full Time

Job Description
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The clinical services department ensures delivery of high quality medical and laboratory services that are patient centered in order to ensure optimal health and well being for patients achieving the organization’s mission and vision.
	The Medical Doctor will perform a range of functions including but not limited to; initial history taking, clinical assessments, diagnosis, treatment, and evaluation of care.
	S/he must demonstrate critical thinking in the clinical decision-making process, especially in assessing and diagnosing patients, leading to the delivery of safe care for all patients.
	The successful candidate will work collaboratively with the healthcare team and the Management Team to meet the needs of the patients, supporting the delivery of policy and procedures.
	The Medical Doctor will also review and act appropriately on blood results and referrals/correspondence regarding patients.
	In addition, S/he will be expected to occasionally carry out some home visits to patients registered on the Membership Scheme.


Responsibilities
Purpose:


	Conduct telemedicine consultations which may involve discussing results and implications of laboratory investigations with patients as well as dealing appropriately with routine and emergency complaints.
	Determine diagnosis and treatment plans, in consultation with patient(s) or referring to Supervising doctor(s) as appropriate. Conduct and oversee clinical care to patients using established clinical guidelines.
	Interview patients, take medical histories, perform physical examinations, analyze,determine, diagnose and explain medical problems during surgery consultations and home visits.
	Participate and oversee all treatment and preventative healthcare services as delegated and agreed upon by the supervising Practice Manager(s). Assist in clinical instruction and supervision of medical and nursing staff as well as other interns/student doctors.                        


Engagement:


	Provide and explain clinical instructions to the nursing staff and other clinical care teams as required. Communicate when necessary with colleagues in Clinical care and hospital specialists in order to discuss or refer specific patients, plan and coordinate activities, or exchange information.
	Communicate where necessary with colleagues in Clinical care and hospital specialists to discuss or recommend referring specific patients, plan and coordinate activities, or exchange information to improve the quality of patient care. 
	Identify and liaise regularly with community hospitals, consultants, and other health care providers, insurance companies, and other community organizations to refer/consult on specific cases, participate in community service and education projects and activities.
	Recommend direct clinical care to patients using established clinical guidelines. Interview patients, take medical histories, perform physical examinations, analyze, diagnose, and explain medical problems during surgery consultations and home visits.


Delivery:


	Fully document all aspects of patient care, reconcile and complete all required paperwork for legal and administrative purposes. Attend regular educational meetings organized by the practice in order to clinical knowledge, practice policy and guidelines timely
	Contribute to clinical development by developing a special interest and help to establish appropriate systems to manage common chronic medical conditions, ensuring compliance with approved standard treatment guidelines.
	Support and Sustain clinical research and efforts within the EHA Clinics leading to the publication of papers.


Requirements ?


	Degree In Medicine - MBBS, MbChB, MD, DO in any Global, National, or State recognized University and conforming to the guidelines as set out by the Medical and Dental Association of Nigeria.
	Completion of compulsory internship and a minimum of post NYSC. 
	Up-to-date registration and license from the MDCN
	Completion of BLS, ACLS.
    

    

        Click here to Apply  
        

    
     




        
        

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Procurement Specialist",
  "description": "Fort Hermon Limited -&nbsp;We are a dynamic engineering and construction company specializing in delivering high-quality infrastructure, building, and industrial projects. With a focus on innovation, safety, and technical excellence, we provide end-to-end solutions that meet global standards and exceed client expectations.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Procurement Specialist
Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Identify, evaluate and select suppliers based on quality, cost,delivery and service.
	Prepare and issue purchase orders and request for quotation(RFQs).
	Conduct market research to identify price, trends,new suppliers and alternatives.
	Ensure timely procurement of goods and services based on operational needs.
	Maintain an up-to-database of reliable suppliers.
	Negotiate favourable terms,pricing and conditions with vendors.
	Monitor supplier performance and ensure compliance with contractual agreements.
	Resolve supplier issues, disputes delays or failures.
	Evaluate procurement processes and recommend improvements.
	Maintain accurate records of contracts,purchase order and procurement activities.
	Work closely with other departments to understand procurement needs.
	Support internal stakeholders with timely procurement.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess relevant qualifications.
	Hands on experience on large procurement within the engineering sector.


Salary
N300,000 - N500,000 / Month.

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;vineonyido@gmail.com&nbsp;using &quot;Application for Procurement Specialist&quot; as the subject of the email.",

Procurement Specialist Job at Fort Hermon Limited




        
    

        
        Fort Hermon Limited - We are a dynamic engineering and construction company specializing in delivering high-quality infrastructure, building, and industrial projects. With a focus on innovation, safety, and technical excellence, we provide end-to-end solutions that meet global standards and exceed client expectations.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Procurement Specialist
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Identify, evaluate and select suppliers based on quality, cost,delivery and service.
	Prepare and issue purchase orders and request for quotation(RFQs).
	Conduct market research to identify price, trends,new suppliers and alternatives.
	Ensure timely procurement of goods and services based on operational needs.
	Maintain an up-to-database of reliable suppliers.
	Negotiate favourable terms,pricing and conditions with vendors.
	Monitor supplier performance and ensure compliance with contractual agreements.
	Resolve supplier issues, disputes delays or failures.
	Evaluate procurement processes and recommend improvements.
	Maintain accurate records of contracts,purchase order and procurement activities.
	Work closely with other departments to understand procurement needs.
	Support internal stakeholders with timely procurement.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess relevant qualifications.
	Hands on experience on large procurement within the engineering sector.


Salary
N300,000 - N500,000 / Month.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: vineonyido@gmail.com using "Application for Procurement Specialist" as the subject of the email.

Health Care Assistant Job at Kingsfield Diagnostic




        
    

        
        Kingsfield Diagnostic provide a comprehensive, accurate and reliable testing to clients across the healthcare sector in Nigeria. Our facilities and experience in diagnostics ensure we can get clinical tests back to you promptly. We also offer wellness packages for the population. Our pathology testing solutions across disciplines including clinical biochemistry, immunology, haematology, sexual health screening and molecular biology.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Health Care Assistant

Job Location: Ikorodu, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Attend to customers
	Requisition management support
	Stock control and management
	Cyclical audits 
	Training will be provided.


Person's Specifications


	Attention to details
	Computer literacy
	Must be available for shift Work periods
	Excellent communication skills
	Live around Ikorodu metropolis.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV to: kingsfieldmedicalservices@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Quality Control Officer",
  "description": "Emmittex Agro Industry Limited (Palm Kernel Oil Mills Division) came into existence with a mission to provide clean and pure&nbsp;indigenous crude palm kernel oil (CPKO) to our teeming Nigerians. The success of this objective is largely in your hands. It is only through your disciplined, efficient, devoted and loyal hard work that you can boost the health of the company and consequently, your own careers.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Quality Control Officer
Job Location:&nbsp;Akwuzu, Anambra
Employment Type: Full-time
Reports To: Quality Control Manager
Industry: Production / Manufacturing

About the Role


	We are seeking a diligent and analytical Quality Control Officer to join our production team.
	This role is critical to ensuring that all products meet the company&rsquo;s quality specifications, regulatory standards, and customer expectations.
	The ideal candidate must be detail-oriented, methodical, and capable of identifying issues early in the production cycle.
	The Quality Control Officer will work closely with the Quality Control Manager, production supervisors, machine operators, and store officers to maintain consistent production quality, reduce wastage, and enhance operational efficiency.


Key Responsibilities


	Inspection &amp; Monitoring: The officer will conduct routine inspections of raw materials, in-process items, and finished products to ensure they meet approved standards.
	Testing &amp; Analysis: The role includes performing physical and visual tests, documenting results, and ensuring samples are collected correctly. The officer will escalate any deviations or defects immediately to the Quality Control Manager.
	Documentation &amp; Reporting: The officer will maintain accurate records of inspections, test results, deviations, production issues, corrective actions, batch numbers, and daily QC logs. They will support the QC Manager in preparing weekly and monthly quality reports.
	Compliance &amp; SOP Enforcement: The officer will ensure production teams follow quality standards, hygiene guidelines, workplace safety rules, and approved SOPs. They will assist in identifying gaps and recommending corrective measures.
	Collaboration with Production Team: The officer will work closely with the production team to monitor processes, identify quality risks, prevent mix-ups, verify calibration of measurement tools, and reduce rework or product wastage.
	Product Release &amp; Rejection: The officer will participate in approving batches that meet required standards and rejecting defective products.


Requirements


	OND / HND / B.Sc. Degree in Microbiology, Industrial Chemistry, Food Science, Engineering, or related field.
	1&ndash;3 years of experience in quality control within a production or manufacturing environment.
	Strong understanding of quality assurance principles.
	Ability to use basic measuring tools, QC forms, and documentation templates.
	Excellent observation, reporting, and communication skills.
	Ability to work under pressure and identify production inconsistencies quickly.
	Strong attention to detail and commitment to accuracy.


What We Offer


	N120,000 monthly salary
	A structured work environment with potential for growth
	Opportunity to work directly with an experienced Quality Control Manager
	Training and exposure to quality management systems.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;talent.hunt1@yahoo.com&nbsp;using&nbsp;&quot;Quality Control Officer &ndash; Production&rdquo; as the subject of the mai",
  "datePosted": "2025-12-09",
  "validThrough": "2025-12-31",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Emmittex Agro Industry Limited"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Anambra",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },
  "identifier": {
    "@type": "PropertyValue",
    "name": "",
    "value": "191550"
  },
  "baseSalary": {
    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",
    "value": {
      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 75000,
      "maxValue": 150000,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



Quality Control Officer Job at Emmittex Agro Industry Limited




        
    

        
        Emmittex Agro Industry Limited (Palm Kernel Oil Mills Division) came into existence with a mission to provide clean and pure indigenous crude palm kernel oil (CPKO) to our teeming Nigerians. The success of this objective is largely in your hands. It is only through your disciplined, efficient, devoted and loyal hard work that you can boost the health of the company and consequently, your own careers.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Quality Control Officer
Job Location: Akwuzu, Anambra
Employment Type: Full-time
Reports To: Quality Control Manager
Industry: Production / Manufacturing

About the Role
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a diligent and analytical Quality Control Officer to join our production team.
	This role is critical to ensuring that all products meet the company’s quality specifications, regulatory standards, and customer expectations.
	The ideal candidate must be detail-oriented, methodical, and capable of identifying issues early in the production cycle.
	The Quality Control Officer will work closely with the Quality Control Manager, production supervisors, machine operators, and store officers to maintain consistent production quality, reduce wastage, and enhance operational efficiency.


Key Responsibilities


	Inspection & Monitoring: The officer will conduct routine inspections of raw materials, in-process items, and finished products to ensure they meet approved standards.
	Testing & Analysis: The role includes performing physical and visual tests, documenting results, and ensuring samples are collected correctly. The officer will escalate any deviations or defects immediately to the Quality Control Manager.
	Documentation & Reporting: The officer will maintain accurate records of inspections, test results, deviations, production issues, corrective actions, batch numbers, and daily QC logs. They will support the QC Manager in preparing weekly and monthly quality reports.
	Compliance & SOP Enforcement: The officer will ensure production teams follow quality standards, hygiene guidelines, workplace safety rules, and approved SOPs. They will assist in identifying gaps and recommending corrective measures.
	Collaboration with Production Team: The officer will work closely with the production team to monitor processes, identify quality risks, prevent mix-ups, verify calibration of measurement tools, and reduce rework or product wastage.
	Product Release & Rejection: The officer will participate in approving batches that meet required standards and rejecting defective products.


Requirements


	OND / HND / B.Sc. Degree in Microbiology, Industrial Chemistry, Food Science, Engineering, or related field.
	1–3 years of experience in quality control within a production or manufacturing environment.
	Strong understanding of quality assurance principles.
	Ability to use basic measuring tools, QC forms, and documentation templates.
	Excellent observation, reporting, and communication skills.
	Ability to work under pressure and identify production inconsistencies quickly.
	Strong attention to detail and commitment to accuracy.


What We Offer


	N120,000 monthly salary
	A structured work environment with potential for growth
	Opportunity to work directly with an experienced Quality Control Manager
	Training and exposure to quality management systems.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: talent.hunt1@yahoo.com using "Quality Control Officer – Production” as the subject of the mai    

    

        Click here to Apply  
        

    
     




        
        

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
